title.label: Fun, but over hyped and not worth $15

content.label:
Great concept and entertaining writing, but starts to get repetitive even after just a handful of plays.

I was expecting a lot more variety after reading people's reviews, and its true that theres a lot of unique text / anecdotes in each game... but so what? A random anecdote here and there doesn't change the game experience much.

Don't get me wrong, this is still an entertaining game, but similar to games that are free or cost just a few bucks, you'll get bored of this game too eventually.
This game wins â€œworst controls everâ€. Also, garbage gfx. Just another game that proves meritocracy is dead and loser sociopaths have taken over.

title.label: The best game on the App Store

content.label: This has to be the best ported console/pc game to phone ever. I have had this game for years, and the devs constantly add new features and game modes. Easy 5/5

10-29-2020 update: Rocketcat still adheres to nothing short of excellence. This dev is definitely worth supporting. But this now if you donâ€™t already have it!

I could have paid $7 or $8, but vacillated for almost a year. Now the title (in accordance with their announced pricing model) has gone up to $12 and . . . I am happy to pay it! These are great devs who have continued to provide exemplary post-release support (think Steam-level post-release support) for this title and others (eg, Wayward Souls from 2014 has a sizable update in the pipeline per the devs). As for DRtC, I see elements of many titles, the most salient of which are Oregon Trail (which I played a couple of times in the â€˜80s on what may have been a Tandy 1000) and FTL: Faster Than Light. Wit and humor abound in this wild romp for the northern border. Thanks, Rocketcat, for another AAA iOS experience and for elevating the platform.

title.label: This game is absolutely amazing (with controller).

content.label:
I donâ€™t know where to start, this game is easily the best game Iâ€™ve ever played. This Masterpiece of comedy, dispair, and gory awesomeness will most certainly keep you playing for a long time. Plus the best part is, itâ€™s literally infinitely playable, when you start up this game the music blasts your ears in rock / techno music, then you notice the character creator with the over 50 perks / traits, I wonâ€™t spoil the rest of this awesomeness of an indie game.
  Now to a different subject, the controls in this game are terrible. So if you have a controller to connect to your iPad, you have been saved from being ripped off (LOL). 
  The gameplay... Shockingly amazing, absolutely brilliant is this gameplay. Bountiful with content, pets, so many weapons, being able to move / pickup (depending on your perk) / throw every piece of furniture and car (yes) there is in the game right now (soon the KIDNEY update will be out soon, so get excited). Playing this game will become your priority for a vary long time, due to only some of the things I have said in this review.
  So are you ready to go get it? If not let me tell you a few more things since I am only showing you the top of the treasure that is this game. If you want, Iâ€™ll relate this game to Sheltered because... well... I can. Think of Sheltered with zombies, with so much gameplay itâ€™s stupid to even fathom. 
  I hope you read this review and are currently pressing that satisfying purchase button, cause you are going to love this game. 

Recap: Tons of replay probability, awesome gameplay, fun comedy , Gore that isnâ€™t unsettling, awesome developer, and loads of character customization (seriously the most you probably ever seen).                                                                 Enjoy a Masterpiece.

  Also, Iâ€™m waiting for ign to rate this game... seriously (LOL).

title.label: This game is so good but it needs...

content.label: This game needs to have more types of ammo and guns I feel deadlier road mode had a lot more zombies then 30% more I think rare characters are not that rare I get them a lot on deadlier road mode thatâ€™s all I have to say itâ€™s still really fun

This game is fun, with just the right amount of difficulty to make it interesting. Its funny, quirky and unique. Ive kept coming back to it year after year. My only issue is, that it does not have cloud save for IOS. Ive lost many save files over the years due to getting a new phone. I really hope cloud save is added soon! I also think it would be cool if characters had skill rollover, if you play as the same ones everytime. Like they could keep what they learned from last time!

Not just a mobile game masterpiece, but on consoles as well. This game is so brilliant and well balanced. I was skeptical 2 years back at the price tag but took the leap of faith and it was the best purchase I have made on my phone. I easily have over 500 plus hours invested in this game and am currently tackling endless mode to earn my ranks with the elite. Unfortunately ran into a bug on day 300 or somewhere close to that day and trading camps and npcs will no longer spawn leaving me unable to continue my play through. Iâ€™m still rating 5 stars since this has been my only game breaking bug and itâ€™s on a mode that not many people even attempt to do so it probably hasnâ€™t received much attention. But devs please post a possible solution for this so I may still have a chance to continue on my current endless run.

title.label: Kinda fun expected more for the price

content.label: Fun but repetitive & expected more for the 15 bucks! 5 is more like it!
Game is fantastic. Very important question... why isnâ€™t there an iCloud backup for this game? I switched phones and I have to start all over. I really donâ€™t like that!

If you have two wireless controllers you can play with your friend classic couch co op style. Never had this much fun with my girlfriend just playing a game together. Really enjoyable game. I donâ€™t write too many reviews on anything but this is truly a master piece. The control feels so smooth and awesome. Graphics are awesome.

This game is by far the best mobile app. If I may be honest I played this game for a day then deleted it then gave it another try. And it was worth it. This game is sooo fun and would recommend it. The only problem is that in my opinion is that itâ€™s a little pricy. I would say $10 max. This game is still worth it and recommend this to other people who like adventure story games

This is one of the greatest games Iâ€™ve had on my phone I love this game please add more.

I got rid of it a while ago and was going to re download it. But I completely forgot about it, but yesterday I just thought about it and it sounded like fun so i hopped on and my save was gone ðŸ˜’
Other than that tho itâ€™s a fantastic game :)
itâ€™s proabbly the best game I have played but the game is super hard

To begin with play with dead zone set to zero. Itâ€™s unplayable without that minor tweak in the settings. Once you do that it has the best controls of any mobile game Iâ€™ve ever played. This game is very difficult however. I put 30 hours in it before I got my first win. Once you master the controls you become a zombie killing machine. This game is excellent for those moments in life where you need a 25-105 minute break from work, Spanish class, or whatever. I often finish all my classwork approximately halfway before class ends and this is what I do after. I am honestly shocked that such a witty and well developed game is able to be run so effectively on a mobile device. This is a game with infinite replay value. Iâ€™m still finding locations and characters that I have not seen, and they are always adding more! It is very rarely that I feel that my all-to-frequent deaths were the games fault. This is very often a frustrating game but winning it is exceptionally satisfying. And after you get to Canada you unlock quite a few more game modes. This is the pinochle of mobile games. All a personâ€™s phone needs is Death Road to Canada, BTD6, and PUBG Mobile. With those games you have entertainment for any situation. If you even think youâ€™ll enjoy it, buy it. Itâ€™s worth much more than they sell it for. Mobile is the perfect platform for this game. You always have your phone so you always have this masterpiece.
Bought the game thinking it was multiplayer. Kind of bummed out about that.

title.label: One of the best games I played

content.label: This game is so good itâ€™s like the organ trail but with zombies and pets and a bunch of alllllll other things so I just wanted to say best game I have played so far but itâ€™s hard on the final siege because I was so close but then all my people died but then when my dog that looked like a detective died and two dogs came but then I died and then I failed so itâ€™s hard trying to get to Canada but itâ€™s fun.

title.label: Amazing zombie game for the mobile, but...

content.label: Whereâ€™s my wayward soul paladin update devs? Itâ€™s been 3 years.

This game is not only the best phone game out there, itâ€™s a serious contender for one of the best games ever made, period. Everything is this game is spectacular, from the beautiful pixel art graphics to the amazing soundtrack, hilarious jokes and fantastic gameplay and ridiculous replay value, Death Road to Canada is a 5/5 in every single category that I can think of. Itâ€™s a game that is a blast to play every single time, and I imagine the developers must have lots of fun designing it and its updates. It is a work of love and it shows. I have unlocked almost all the achievements (Iâ€™m only missing two that are calendar-related and a hidden one), and still canâ€™t stop playing. Absolutely awesome game, play it!

The game is really good, combining comedy into an apocalypse survival game. However, it is a bit expensive, but worth the money. It isnâ€™t exactly a story game, just a classic zombie apocalypse survival game where youâ€™re trying to make it to Canada.
(aka the game is epic)

title.label: Great game but a few changes

content.label:
Iâ€™ve only had this game for a few days, but it is by far one of the best games on the App Store. However, there are a few things that I felt could be changed.
1. App pricing 
I saw from another review that this app was 7 dollars before, which is a much more reasonable price than $15 for a mobile app.
2. Custom characters
The character creator and familiar character mode are cool for adding friends and family into the game, but I was disappointed when I couldnâ€™t add my dog into the game.
Otherwise, great game
P.S.
Sorry if this was too long!
Iâ€™ve been playing this game for 3 three years and with the scarcity of loot, Zombie loot can really be useful on a lot of runs. Overall this is a great game.

And add like more food you got in the game (when you start) since I been low on food(I have bad luck) and I want that to change so please add those things in the game, but overall itâ€™s a really good game though so yea.........

I have played alot of zombie games this one is one of my favorites I hope they add more traits and random events

I usually donâ€™t mind spending bucks on games as long as theyâ€™re good. Not this one. The decisions-making-surviving-stories is okay. But the combat is terrible. It has the worst moving touch pad. And itâ€™s just generally not easy to walk around in the world - where thereâ€™re zombies chasing you. Itâ€™s very easy to mistakenly swap your weapons when you want to attack. Your teammateâ€™s AI is quite terrible. It has the potential to be a really cool game but overall itâ€™s just frustrating.

title.label: Without a doubt the best mobile game

content.label: I have so much respect for the creators of this game, this is by far the greatest game on the iPhone (not including hearthstone, thatâ€™s a computer game). This game is so refined and polished to the point where I canâ€™t believe itâ€™s only 15 bucks! Honestly the replay value of this game with its tons of events, characters, vehicles, weapons, areas, game modes, and hilarious jokes is unmatched by any console game I can think of. Itâ€™s hard, and sometimes deaths can be aggravating, but each death lets you learn, okay, next time I wonâ€™t try to wrestle a moose! The custom character creator is brilliant with traits and perks of your friends and family give the game a personal touch and some funny scenarios, like how the â€œBerserkâ€ trait has a character maul 3 bandits to save the group without a thought. The game is just simply a blast to play, from the careful decision making to the crazy stressful sieges. I wonâ€™t spill too luck of the gameplay because I want people to experience it for themselves. Put short, this game is a masterpiece, 5 stars without question. And one more thing, the developers listened to my complaint, I wonâ€™t say what, because again spoilers, but yeah this company cares about their games!

What if you can drive the car around or ADD PLANES?! That would be cool to fly a plane and have airports the planes could be faster but it would be rare also LOVE THE GAME keep up da good work my peeps!

Apparently the game was 7$ a year ago according to another review which is a more reasonable price in my opinion. 

My main gripe with the game is the tutorial system or lack thereof. When you start the game they put you into a tutorial which shows you the basics of moving, attacking, and looting I guess. But they donâ€™t explain to you what I think is a majority of the game the item management and character optimizations. The tutorial doesnâ€™t show you what different weapon types do, how they interact with certain stats, or even how the guns work. Often times a character would be low health while I had a healing supplies but I didnâ€™t know how to use them. There is a lot if depth to how characters are defined stat and class wise but without an explanation I found it frustrating to die repeatedly because I couldnâ€™t understand what was happening. 

Also I have an issue with how the controls for moving are implemented. It might just be me but because you have an area that you slide ur finger around to move the character, I found myself having to repeatedly move my thumb back to neutral position because it would eventually run out of room on the screen. I like the other static joy stick style controls more because it makes me feel like I have more control.

This is an incredible little game that is ruined by RNG. Prepare to spend 30+ minutes building up a great team and characters just to lose everything in 45 seconds because of random events beyond your control. This will happen to you 9/10 runs, so donâ€™t play this game if you canâ€™t handle repeated and intense unfairness/BS.

Update: yep, this game is still broken.

Sometimes certain things like characters in rescues wonâ€™t spawn in, crashes after you finish a looting event which is EXTREMELY frustrating. Iâ€™m trying my hand at Endless Mode and Iâ€™m being held back by these horrible bugs.
This game epic
Itâ€™s a fun game, really it is. But 15 bucks is way too much.

Just a suggestion, I love the game and all, but I have some things I want:
â€¢Having the opportunity to camp defend (similar to Sieges but you can leave whenever you want and doesnâ€™t take up any time)
â€¢Forcing a team member to quit
â€¢CAR CUSTOMIZATION!!!
Thank you!
It is over priced when you should only sell it for 6.99

title.label: The best survival game in history on Apple Store!

content.label: The longest and the most challenging game I have ever played! Very fun game! This game makes you think twice and the story is so random. Great dialogues and hard to find rare items and weapons! Lost 18 times and won once. It was a great journey experience!

The humor is spot on and the pixel art is beautiful. The soundtrack is great and the rng elements make this game a extremely replayable game. The price is a little high, but the game is exactly the same as one pc so I say itâ€™s a good buy.

This rad game is packed with random encounters and places thatâ€™ll destroy your groupsâ€™ morale into the face of the earth. You could find bandits that take all of your supplies, you could be packed in a tiny room while waves of zombies flood in and you know that if you run through, youâ€™ll be eaten alive, but if you have a good weapon like a chainsaw, you can demolish them... But you might have left the chainsaw in the back of the car, you see what Iâ€™m saying? This game will constantly try to hit you in the face with a tree, but thereâ€™s always that whimsical random encounter or event thatâ€™ll be sure to make you laugh. Overall, Death Road To Canada is a game thatâ€™s able to balance out cruelty with funny content, and is worth the money. ðŸ‘Œ

I got into this game on the Nintendo Switch and also got it for my iPad. Great game with replay ability. The controls arnt an issue either. Mostly just a moving arrow and attack and interact command.

Lots of random good and bad events, I was just saved by She Thor just before a siege! Itâ€™s also great to create your own characters and inject them into the game. A must buy indie game!
